*   Larawan ng iyong card ng talaan sa pagbabakuna na naka-store sa isang telepono o iba pang electronic na device
*   Aktwal o digital na dokumentasyon ng form ng pagbabakuna mula sa isang provider ng pangangalagang pangkalusugan o iba pang issuer.
*   [Digital na Talaan ng Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record, DCVR). 

Basahin ang [Mga Alituntunin at Pamantayan sa Talaan ng Bakuna](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) ng CDPH para sa kumpletong detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Ano ang ibig sabihin ng “ganap nang nabakunahan”?
Answer:
Itinuturing na kumpleto na sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ang mga tao:

*   Dalawang linggo matapos niyang matanggap ang pangalawang dosis sa isang seryeng may 2 dosis (Pfizer or Moderna), o
*   Dalawang linggo matapos niyang matanggap ang bakunang may iisang dosis lang (Johnson & Johnson).

Ang mga booster na dosis ay hindi kinakailangan para maituring na may kumpleto nang bakuna. Pero inirerekomenda naming magpaturok ka ng booster kapag kwalipikado ka na, para makuha ang pinakamatinding proteksyon laban sa COVID-19.

Tingnan ang [Mga Rekomendasyon sa Pampublikong Kalusugan para sa Mga Taong Kumpleto sa Bakuna sa Panahon ng COVID-19 (COVID-19 Public Health Recommendations for Fully Vaccinated People)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/COVID-19-Public-Health-Recommendations-for-Fully-Vaccinated-People.aspx) ng CDPH para sa mga detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Magpopositibo ba ako sa COVID-19 dahil sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Hindi. Hindi ka magpopositibo sa [mga pagsusuri ng virus](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/diagnostic-testing.html) dahil sa isang bakuna.

Kung makakagawa ang iyong katawan ng immune response, puwede kang magpositibo sa [mga pagsusuri sa antibody](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/serology-overview.html). Ipinapakita nitong posibleng mayroon kang proteksyon laban sa virus.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Paano mapoprotektahan ang aking privacy kung magpapabakuna ako laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Lubos na pinaghihigpitan ng batas ng California kung paano puwedeng ibahagi ang personal na impormasyon. Pinipigilan ng estado na makilala ang mga indibidwal sa nakabahaging data.

Magbasa pa sa [Kasunduan sa Paggamit ng Data ng California at Mga Madalas Itanong](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/California-Data-Use-Agreement.aspx) ng CDPH.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Dapat ko bang itabi ang aking COVID-19 vaccination record card?
Answer:
Oo. Itabi ang iyong card ng talaan sa pagbabakuna sa isang ligtas na lugar para hindi ito mawala o masira

Makakakuha sa portal ng [Digital na Talaan ng Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record, DCVR) ng digital na kopya ng talaang ito. Kung nawala mo ang iyong papel na card, i-print out ang digital na talaan mo. Puwede mo itong gamitin sa anumang lugar kung saan maipapakita mo ang iyong papel na card.

Basahin ang [Mga Alituntunin at Pamantayan sa Talaan ng Bakuna](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) ng CDPH para sa kumpletong detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kung kukuha ako ng booster shot o karagdagang dosis, makikita ba ito sa aking digital na vaccine record?
Answer:
Hindi awtomatikong lalabas ang mga ito sa iyong digital na vaccine record. Kakailanganin mong pumunta sa portal ng [Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) para kumuha ng bagong QR code.

Maghintay ng 14 na araw para lumabas ang iyong bagong dosis sa California Immunization Registry bago ka kumuha ng bagong QR code.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kailangan ba ng mga provider ng pahintulot ng magulang bago magturok ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 sa isang menor de edad?
Answer:
Oo. Bago magbakuna ng isang menor de edad, dapat munang humingi ang mga provider ng bakuna ng pahintulot mula sa isang:

*   Magulang, 
*   Legal na tagapangalaga, o 
*   Iba pang nasa hustong gulang na may legal na kustodiya. 

May ilang pagbubukod:

*   Hindi kailangan ng [mga emancipated minor](https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/codes_displaySection.xhtml?lawCode=FAM&sectionNum=7050.) ng pahintulot ng magulang o tagapag-alaga para makatanggap ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19.
*   Posibleng tumanggap ang mga provider ng nakasulat na pahintulot. Dapat ay mula ito sa magulang o legal na tagapag-alaga ng isang unaccompanied minor. Dapat kumpirmahin ng pahintulot na ito na natanggap ng magulang/tagapag-alaga ang [Sheet ng Impormasyon sa EUA ng Pfizer](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download).
*   Katanggap-tanggap ang pahintulot sa pamamagitan ng telepono o video. Dapat kumpirmahin ng magulang/tagapag-alaga na natanggap niya ang [Sheet ng Impormasyon sa EUA ng Pfizer](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download). Puwede ring basahin ang sheet ng impormasyon sa magulang/tagapangalaga.

Dapat tanungin ng mga pamilya ang kanilang provider ng bakuna tungkol sa mga tinatanggap ng form ng pahintulot. Tingnan ang [Gabay sa Pahintulot sa Menor de Edad para sa Bakuna ng Pfizer](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Pfizer-Vaccine-Minor-Consent-Guidance.aspx) ng CDPH para sa higit pang detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Bakit ko dapat pabakunahan ang aking anak?
Answer:
Tumataas ang mga kaso sa mga bata. Dapat mabakunahan natin ang mga bata para maiwasan ang higit pang pagpapaospital at pagkamatay.

Puwedeng mapigilan ng pagbabakuna ang pagkalat ng mga variant ng coronavirus. Puwede rin nitong mabawasan ang bilang ng mga taong madaling mahawahan ng COVID-19. Sa pamamagitan ng pagbabakuna sa mga batang 5 taong gulang pataas, mas magiging ligtas ang mga pamilya habang bumabalik tayo sa mga bagay na gusto nating gawin.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Nagkaroon na ang aking anak ng mga reaksyon sa ibang bakuna. Dapat pa rin ba niyang kunin ang bakuna?
Answer:
Oo, maliban na lang kung nagkaroon na sila ng mga anaphylactic na uri ng reaksyon sa mga sangkap ng bakuna ng Pfizer. Bihira lang ang mga allergic na reaksyon sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19. Makipag-usap sa doktor ng iyong anak bago siya magpabakuna kung nakaranas siya ng: 

*   Malubhang allergy
*   Mga reaksyon sa bakuna laban sa trangkaso

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede bang pabakunahan ang mga batang mayroon nang dating kundisyon, tulad ng hika?
Answer: Ang mga batang 5 taong gulang pataas ay puwede pa ring makatanggap ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 kahit mayroon silang mga kundisyon sa kalusugan. Kausapin ang iyong doktor o klinika tungkol sa mga partikular na kundisyon ng iyong anak.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kakailanganin bang magpabakuna ng aking anak para makadalo sa personal na pag-aaral?
Answer: Oo. Malapit nang pag-atasan ang mga mag-aaral na mabakunahan para sa in-person na pag-aaral. Sisimulan nito ang termino kasunod ng ganap na pag-apruba ng FDA sa bakuna para sa saklaw ng kanilang baitang (7-12 at K-6). Idaragdag ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19 sa listahan ng mga kinakailangang bakuna para sa paaralan. Kasama rito ang mga bakuna para sa tigdas, beke, rubella, at higit pa.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Bakit natagalan ang pag-apruba ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19 para sa mga bata?
Answer:
Ang mga pagsubok ng bakuna ay karaniwang nagsisimula sa mas nakakatanda at mas bulnerableng populasyon. Nakakaabot ito sa mga mas batang edad. Binabalanse ng naka-phase na paraang ito sa pagiging kwalipikado ang pangangailangang maging ligtas at mabilis.

Napatunayan sa mga klinikal na pagsubok, na may mahigit 4,500 batang 5-11 taong gulang, na ligtas at epektibo ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19. Nagresulta ito sa mahusay na pagtugon sa antibody sa mga batang natanggap ang bakuna.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Isa akong employer at gusto kong tulungan ang aking mga empleyado na mabakunahan. Paano ko ito magagawa?
Answer:
Nakasaad sa [Toolkit ng Employer sa Pagbabakuna](https://saferatwork.covid19.ca.gov/employer-vaccination-toolkit/) ang lahat ng impormasyong kailangan mo para:

*   Makipag-partner sa mga lokal na provider para sa mga offsite na event sa pagbabakuna
*   Humiling ng worksite na mobile na klinika
*   Tulungan ang mga empleyado na makahanap at mag-book ng mga appointment sa pagbabakuna
*   Magbahagi at mag-promote ng mga resource na sumusuporta sa mga empleyado sa pagpapabakuna

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede bang iutos ng isang employer ang pagpapabakuna laban sa COVID-19 para sa lahat ng empleyadong pumapasok sa trabaho?
Answer:
Oo, kung natutugunan ang ilang partikular na ipinag-aatas. Sa ilalim ng ADA, posibleng atasan ng employer ang lahat ng empleyado na matugunan ang isang pamantayan na:

*   Nauugnay sa trabaho, at 
*   Nakakatugon sa pangangailangan ng negosyo

Puwedeng may kasama itong pamantayang nauugnay sa kaligtasan, na nangangailangan ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19.

Kung hindi mababakunahan ang isang empleyado dahil sa isang kapansanan, posibleng hindi siya atasan ng employer na magpabakuna. Ang pagbubukod roon ay kung banta sa kalusugan o kaligtasan ng empleyado o ng ibang tao sa lugar ng trabaho ang hindi pagsunod ng nasabing empleyado.

Basahin ang [Ang Dapat Mong Malaman Tungkol sa COVID-19 at ADA, ang Batas sa Rehabilitasyon (Rehabilitation Act), at iba pang Batas sa Patas na Oportunidad sa Trabaho (Equal Employment Opportunity, EEO)](https://www.eeoc.gov/wysk/what-you-should-know-about-covid-19-and-ada-rehabilitation-act-and-other-eeo-laws).

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kinakailangan bang mabakunahan ang mga taong may mga partikular na trabaho?
Answer:
Oo. Sa California, kasama rito ang:

*   Mga manggagawa sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan
*   Ang mga nagtatrabaho sa mga congregate na lugar (tulad ng mga homeless shelter at koreksyonal na pasilidad)
*   Mga empleyado ng estado
*   Mga manggagawa sa pangangalaga
*   Mga guro sa K-12 at kawani ng paaralan

Ang mga **panggagawa sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan** at **manggagawa sa mga congregate na lugar** ay dapat may kumpletong bakuna at magpabakuna ng booster. Makakagawa lang ng mga pagbubukod para sa mga taong may:

*   Mga salungat na paniniwala sa relihiyon, o
*   Mga kwalipikadong medikal na dahilan. 

Kung hindi kumpleto ang bakuna nila, inaatasan sila na:

*   Regular na magpasuri para sa COVID-19
*   Magsuot ng mask o iba pang personal na pamprotektang kagamitan (personal protective equipment, PPE) sa trabaho. 

Magbasa pa sa:

*   [Q&A sa Kinakailangan sa Bakuna ng Manggagawa sa Pangangalagang Pangkalusugan](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/FAQ-Health-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement.aspx)
*   [Q&A sa Mga Pasilidad sa Pangangalaga sa Nasa Hustong Gulang at Direct Care Worker](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Adult-Care-Facilities-and-Direct-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement-FAQ.aspx)
*   [Q&A sa Proteksyon sa Mga High-Risk na Setting](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Unvaccinated-Workers-in-High-Risk-Settings-State-Public-Health-Order-FAQ.aspx)
*   [Kinakailangan sa pagpapabakuna para sa mga manggagawa sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan sa mga koreksyonal na pasilidad at detention center](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Correctional-Facilities-and-Detention-Centers-Health-Care-Worker-Vaccination-Order.aspx)

Kumpleto rin dapat sa bakuna o regular dapat na magpasuri para sa COVID-19 ang ****mga empleyado ng estado ng California****. Tingnan ang mga detalye sa [Pagberipika ng Bakuna at Mga Kinakailangan sa Pagsusuri ng CalHR (PDF)](https://www.calhr.ca.gov/Documents/Vaccine-Verification-and-Testing-Requirements.pdf).

Ang ****mga guro sa K-12**** at ****empleyado ng paaralan** ay** dapat [kumpleto sa bakuna o dapat silang magpabakuna linggo-linggo](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Vaccine-Verification-for-Workers-in-Schools.aspx) para sa COVID-19.

Dapat bakunado ang ****mga manggagawa sa mga pasilidad para sa pangangalaga ng mga nasa hustong gulang at nakatatanda**** at ****manggagawa para sa pangangalaga sa tahanan.**** Para sa mga detalye at pagbubukod, tingnan ang [pampublikong kautusan sa kalusugan noong Setyembre 28](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Adult-Care-Facilities-and-Direct-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement.aspx).

Pinalawig ng CDPH ang kautusang ito para isama ang **mga manggagawa sa senior living** at ang mga **manggagawa sa hospice**. Tingnan ang [FAQ tungkol sa pagpapalawig sa kinakailangan sa bakuna](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Adult-Care-Facilities-and-Direct-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement-FAQ.aspx) para sa mga detalye.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kung magpapabakuna ako laban sa COVID-19, kakailanganin ko pa rin bang magpabakuna para sa trangkaso?
Answer: Oo. Hindi nagbibigay ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng proteksyon laban sa trangkaso.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Mayroon bang ilang partikular na populasyon na hindi dapat magpabakuna para sa COVID-19? Paano naman ang mga taong may mga allergy?
Answer:
[Inirerekomenda ng CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html) na:

*   Kung nakaranas ka ng malubha o agarang reaksyon sa isang mRNA na bakuna o sa mga sangkap nito:
    *   Huwag kunin ang bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna. 
    *   Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Janssen.
*   Kung nakaranas ka ng malubha o agarang reaksyon sa bakuna ng Johnson & Johnson o sa mga sangkap nito:
    *   Huwag nang kunin ito ulit. 
    *   Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna.
*   Kung nagkaroon ka ng agarang allergic na reaksyon pagkatapos ng unang dosis ng isang bakuna para sa COVID-19:
    *   Huwag kunin ang pangalawang dosis.  
*   Kung allergic ka sa PEG:
    *   Huwag kunin ang bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna.
    *   Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Johnson & Johnson.
*   Kung allergic ka sa polysorbate:
    *   Huwag kunin ang bakuna ng Johnson & Johnson.
    *   Tanungin ang iyong doktor kung puwede kang magpaturok ng bakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna.

Puwedeng magpabakuna ang mga taong may mga medikal na kundisyon, basta't hindi sila [allergic sa mga sangkap ng bakuna](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html). Matuto pa tungkol sa mga pagsasaalang-alang sa pagbabakuna [para sa mga taong may mga dati nang medikal na kundisyon](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/underlying-conditions.html).

Para matuto tungkol sa mga sangkap sa mga awtorisadong bakuna laban sa COVID-19, tingnan ang

*   [Impormasyon tungkol sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng Pfizer-BioNTech](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Pfizer-BioNTech.html)
*   [Impormasyon tungkol sa bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng Moderna](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Moderna.html)
*   [Impormasyon Tungkol sa Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 ng Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/janssen.html)

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kung buntis o nagpapasuso ako, dapat ba akong magpabakuna para sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Oo. Lubos na inirerekomenda ng CDC na kung buntis ka o posibleng buntis ka, dapat kang magpabakuna. Kung magkakaroon ka ng COVID-19 habang buntis ka, mas malamang na magkaroon ka ng malubhang karamdaman.  

Ligtas ang mga bakuna para sa iyo at iyong sanggol. Walang buhay na virus ang mga ito, kaya hindi makakapagdulot ang mga ito ng COVID-19. Naipapasa rin ng mga buntis ang mga antibody sa kanilang fetus sa sinapupunan. Ibig sabihin, ipinapanganak ang kanilang mga sanggol nang may kaunting proteksyon.

Ligtas din ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 para sa mga pinapasuso ang kanilang mga sanggol. Ang mga nagpapasuso na nakatanggap ng mga bakuna ng Moderna o Pfizer ay may mga antibody sa kanilang gatas ng ina. Posible itong makatulong na protektahan ang kanilang mga sanggol.

Makipag-usap sa iyong doktor kung mayroon kang mga tanong tungkol sa pagpapaturok ng bakuna laban sa COVID-19.

Para sa higit pang impormasyon, basahin ang:

*   [Gabay para sa Pagpapabakuna sa Panahon ng Pagbubuntis](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccination-During-Pregnancy-Guidance.aspx) ng CDPH
*   [Mga Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 Habang Buntis o Nagpapasuso ng Sanggol](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/pregnancy.html) ng CDC
*   [Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 at Pagbubuntis (PDF)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/CDPH%20Document%20Library/COVID-19/COVID-19-Vaccine-and-Pregnancy.pdf) ng CDPH

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Gaano katagal ako dapat maghintay bago ko kunin ang bakuna pagkatapos kong magkaroon ng COVID-19?
Answer:
Inirerekomenda ng [CDC ang sumusunod:](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fvaccines%2Fcovid-19%2Finfo-by-product%2Fpfizer%2Fclinical-considerations.html)

*   Kung ikaw ay nagpositibo, may mga hindi malalang sintomas, at hindi ginamot, dapat kang:
    *   Maghintay ng hindi bababa sa 10 araw pagkatapos magsimula ang mga sintomas ng COVID-19, at 
    *   Tugunan ang [mga pamantayan sa paghinto sa pag-isolate](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/disposition-in-home-patients.html) bago kunin ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19.
*   Maghintay ng 90 araw bago kunin ang bakuna kung:
    *   Kagagaling mo lang mula sa pagkakahawa ng COVID-19, at  
    *   Ginamot ka gamit ang mga monoclonal antibody o convalescent plasma.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede ko bang kunin ang bakuna para sa COVID-19 kasabay ng ibang bakuna?
Answer: Oo, puwede kang magpabakuna para sa COVID-19 at kumuha ng iba pang bakuna (gaya ng para sa trangkaso) sa iisang pagbisita. Hindi mo na kailangang maghintay nang 14 na araw pagkatapos ng ibang bakuna. Matuto pa tungkol sa [pagkuha ng mahigit sa isang uri ng bakuna](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html#Coadministration).\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Puwede ba akong pumili sa pagitan ng iba't ibang bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Oo. Sa [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) at [Vaccines.gov](https://vaccines.gov/search/), makakapaghanap ka ng mga bakuna ayon sa manufacturer.

Basahin ang [Pagpili sa Bakuna Laban sa COVID-19 na Naaangkop sa Iyo (PDF)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/CDPH%20Document%20Library/COVID-19/Which-Vaccine-is-Right-for-Me-Fact-Sheet.pdf) ng CDPH.

Kung kukuha ka ng booster shot, puwede mong piliing kumuha ng brand ng bakuna na iba sa orihinal mong natanggap.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Aprubado ba ng FDA ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
May dalawang aprubado. Ang bakuna ng Pfizer, na tinatawag na ngayong Comirnaty, ay may ganap na pag-apruba ng FDA para sa paggamit para sa sinumang 16 taong gulang pataas. Ang bakuna ng Moderna ay aprubado para sa mga 18 taong gulang pataas.

Puwedeng pahintulan ng FDA ang paggamit ng mga bakuna bago ang ganap na pag-apruba. Tinatawag itong Awtorisasyon sa Emergency na Paggamit (Emergency Use Authorization, EUA). Nagbibigay-daan ito sa atin na tumugon nang mabilis sa mga emergency na sitwasyon tulad ng isang pandemic. Mayroon pa ring napapaloob na masusing pagsusuri sa mga EUA para sa kaligtasan at bisa ng mga ito.

Ang bakuna ng Johnson & Johnson ay may EUA para sa paggamit ng sinumang may edad na 18 taon pataas. Ang bakuna ng Pfizer ay may EUA para sa mga bata na 12 hanggang 15 taong gulang. Ang bakuna ng Pfizer na may mas mababang dosis ay may EUA para sa paggamit sa mga batang may edad na 5 hanggang 11 taon.

Kung naghihintay ka para sa ganap na pag-apruba ng FDA ng isang bakuna bago magpabakuna, tapos na ang iyong paghihintay. Bumisita sa [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) at i-book ang araw ng iyong pagpapabakuna ng Pfizer o Moderna.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Mandatoryo ba ang mga bakuna para sa COVID-19?
Answer: Hindi. Hindi ka inaatasan ng estado o pederal na pamahalaan na magpabakuna. Umaasa kaming pipiliin ng mga Californian na magpabakuna kapag nakita na nila kung gaano ito kaligtas at kaepektibo.\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Kailangan ko bang magpabakuna para bumisita sa isang pasilidad sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan?
Answer:
Oo. Dapat kang magpakita ng katibayan na kumpleto ka sa bakuna at may booster ka na (kung 6 na buwan o higit pa na ang lumipas mula nang magpabakuna ka) kung pupunta ka sa isang:

*   Ospital
*   Pasilidad ng sanay na pag-aalaga
*   Pasilidad ng intermediate na pangangalaga 
*   Pasilidad para sa pangangalaga ng mga nasa hustong gulang at nakatatanda

Kung hindi ka pa kumpleto sa bakuna at wala ka pang booster, dapat kang magpakita ng katibayan ng negatibong pagsusuri sa COVID-19.

*   Isang araw bago ang pagpapatingin (para sa pagsusuri para sa antigen)
*   Dalawang araw bago ang pagpapatingin (para sa pagsusuri para sa PCR)

Nakabukod sa panuntunang ito ang:

*   Mga pagbisita sa isang pasyenteng malapit nang pumanaw
*   Mga emergency na sitwasyon

Ang lahat ng bisita ay dapat magsuot ng mask at naaangkop na PPE at dumistansya sa isa't isa sa kanilang pagbisita. Basahin ang [mga kinakailangan ng bisita sa pangangalagang pangkalusugan](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Requirements-for-Visitors-in-Acute-Health-Care-and-Long-Term-Care-Settings.aspx) at ang [FAQ](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Requirements-for-Visitors-in-Acute-Health-Care-and-Long-Term-Care-Settings-FAQ.aspx) ng CDPH.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Paano ko makukumbinsi ang aking pamilya at mga kaibigan na magpabakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer:
Posibleng maging mahirap ang pakikipag-usap sa pamilya at mga kaibigan tungkol sa mga benepisyo ng pagpapabakuna laban sa COVID-19. Subukang makinig nang walang panghuhusga at tukuyin ang ugat ng kanilang mga alalahanin. Kasama sa mga bagay na dapat tandaan para makatulong sa pagbubukas ng talakayan ang:

*   Pakikinig sa mga tanong nang may pang-unawa
*   Pagtatanong ng mga tanong na walang iisang sagot para matuklasan ang mga alalahanin
*   Paghingi ng pahintulot para magbahagi ng impormasyon
*   Pagtulong sa kanilang malaman ang kanilang sariling dahilan para magpabakuna
*   Tulungan na mangyari ang kanilang pagpapabakuna

Basahin ang [Paano kausapin ang mga kaibigan at kapamilya tungkol sa mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 (How to talk about COVID-19 vaccines with friends and family)](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/talk-about-vaccines.html?ACSTrackingID=USCDC_2067-DM52837&ACSTrackingLabel=How%20to%20Talk%20to%20Family%20and%20Friends%20about%20COVID-19%20Vaccines%20%7C%20COVID-19&deliveryName=USCDC_2067-DM52837) ng CDC.

More info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Ligtas ba ang mga bakuna para sa mga batang may edad na 5 taon pataas?
Answer: Ang bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ng Pfizer ay [para sa mga batang may edad na 12 taon pataas](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-emergency-use).  Ang isang bakuna ng Pfizer na may mas mababang dosis ay [awtorisado na ngayon para sa mga batang may edad na 5 taon hanggang 11](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-authorizes-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-emergency-use-children-5-through-11-years-age).\n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Paano umeepekto ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19?
Answer: Tinuturuan ng mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ang ating mga immune system kung paano labanan ang virus na nagdudulot ng COVID-19. Posible pa ring magkaroon ng COVID-19 pagkatapos magpabakuna. Pero malamang ay hindi maging masyadong malala ang mga sintomas mo, kaya makakaiwas ka sa pagkakaospital at pagkamatay. \n\nMore info: [Mga Bakuna](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vaccines/)

Question: Impormasyon sa chart
Answer:
*   Ang chart na ito ay ginawa gamit ang Genomic Surveillance Data ng Departamento ng Pampublikong Kalusugan ng California (California Department of Public Health, CDPH).
*   Ang mga porsyentong ito ay batay sa 7 araw na average, na may 14 na araw na lag.
*   Ang mga porsyentong ito ay batay sa sample ng mga positibo sa pagsusuri sa COVID-19. Hindi kinakatawan ng mga ito ang kabuuang bilang ng mga impeksyon sa California.
*   Hindi nito kinakatawan ang lahat ng sequence na nakumpleto.
*   Hindi ipinapakita sa chart na ito ang lahat ng natukoy na variant. Ipinapakita lang nito iyong mga itinuturing o itinuring na variant.
*   Ang Departamento ng Pampublikong Kalusugan ng California ay nakikipagtulungan sa maraming partner para makamit ang layunin sa pagsasagawa ng sequencing sa hindi bababa sa 10% ng lahat ng nagpositibo sa pagsusuri. Nagbibigay ito ng kumpiyansang pagtatantya sa pagkalat ng variant sa California.
*   Ina-update namin ang data na ito tuwing Huwebes.
*   Matuto pa tungkol sa kung [paano nagse-sequence ang California ng mga positiong pagsusuri sa COVID-19 sa pamamagitan ng genetics](https://testing.covid19.ca.gov/covidnet/).

More info: [Mga Variant](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/variants/)

Question: Gaano katagal may mga incentive card? Hanggang kailan ang programa?
Answer: Naging available lang ang mga card sa unang 2 milyong kwalipikadong indibidwal na nagsimulang magpabakuna noong Mayo 27 hanggang Hulyo 18, 2021. Natapos ang programa noong Enero 7, 2022.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Kung nakuha ko na ang aking dosis bago magsimula ang programa sa incentive card, at kukunin ko ang aking pangalawang dosis pagkatapos nitong magsimula, kwalipikado ba ako?
Answer: Hindi, hindi ka naging kwalipikadong makatanggap ng incentive card. Pero naging kwalipikado ka para sa iba pang cash at bakasyong papremyo. Layunin ng programa sa card na hikayatin ang mga hindi pa nababakunahang Californian na magpabakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Makakatanggap ba ako ng $50 na incentive card kung nakumpleto ko ang aking bakuna bago magsimula ang programa?
Answer: Hindi. Layunin ng programa sa incentive card na hikayatin ang mga natitirang Californian na magpabakuna. Gayunpaman, naging kwalipikado para sa iba pang cash at bakasyong papremyo ang mga Californian na kumpleto na sa bakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano ko makukuha ang aking redemption code?
Answer: Kung sinimulan mong magpabakuna noong Mayo 27 hanggang Hulyo 18, 2021 makakakuha ka ng redemption code sa pamamagitan ng text o email sa loob ng 7-10 araw pagkatapos ng huli mong bakuna. Para sa mga tatanggap ng seryeng may dalawang dosis, itatabi ang iyong $50 na card hanggang sa makuha mo ang iyong pangalawang dosis.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Gaano katagal bago natanggap ang incentive card pagkatapos itong i-redeem?
Answer: Inabot nang hanggang limang araw ng negosyo bago matanggap ang incentive card.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano napatunayan ng mga taong tapos na sila sa dalawang dosis? Paano kung may susubok na mandaya sa pamamagitan ng pekeng card ng bakuna?
Answer: Ang mga bakuna laban sa COVID-19 ay sinusubaybayan sa mga talaan sa pagbabakuna ng California. Ibibigay ang mga incentive card at iba pang cash na papremyo batay sa mga talaang iyon.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: May opsyon ba sa mga incentive card?
Answer:
Oo, may tatlong pagpipilian:

1.  Virtual Mastercard®: Hindi ATM card kaya hindi ito puwedeng i-cash out. Puwede itong i-redeem online sa mga lugar na tumatanggap ng Debit Mastercard®. Isa itong virtual na incentive card, at puwede itong idagdag sa mobile wallet sa telepono.
2.  Kroger: Good at Ralphs, Food 4 Less, at Foods Co. Inirerekomenda naming i-print ang card, dahil hindi lahat ng grocery ay may kakayahang i-scan ito sa telepono. _(Tandaan: Hindi tumatanggap ng card bilang bayad ang ilang Food 4 Less na tindahan sa Northern California at sa Central Coast. _Tingnan ang_ [_listahang ito ng mga kalahok na lokasyon ng Kroger_ (PDF)](https://files.covid19.ca.gov/pdf/Ralphs-Food4Less-FoodsCo-CA-list.pdf)_._)_
3.  Albertsons: Good at Safeway, Albertsons, Vons, Pavilions, at Andronico's Community Market. Inirerekomenda naming i-print ang card, dahil hindi lahat ng grocery ay may kakayahang i-scan ito sa telepono.

Kung wala ka pang 18 taong gulang, kailangan ay may magulang o tagapangalaga ka na kukumpleto sa proseso ng pagpili ng card para sa iyo, maliban na lang kung isa kang emancipated na menor de edad.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nag-e-expire ba ang aking redemption code?
Answer: Oo. Nagamit mo na dapat ang redemption code bago ang Enero 7, 2022. Kapag na-claim na ito, mag-e-expire ang Virtual Mastercard® pagkalipas ng 12 buwan. Hindi nag-e-expire ang mga grocery card.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Ano ang kinailangan kong gawin para makasali sa mga draw?
Answer: Kinailangan lang na sa California ka nagpabakuna para sa COVID-19 bago nag-draw ng mga panalo. Hindi kinailangan ng form sa pagsali; awtomatiko kang naisali sa draw batay sa mga talaan para sa pagbabakuna ng California nang ibigay ng iyong tagapagbakuna ang impormasyon mo sa registry para sa pagbabakuna ng estado. Isinaalang-alang ang mga bakuna Pfizer, Moderna, o Johnson & Johnson man ang kinuha mo. Nakatira ka dapat sa California para manalo. Nakuha ng nanalo ang papremyo pagkatapos niyang nakuha ang kanyang serye ng pagpapabakuna.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano kung nagpabakuna ako sa labas ng My Turn system ng California?
Answer: Hindi kailangang sa pamamagitan ng My Turn ka nagpabakuna para maging kwalipikado ka. Kwalipikado ka pa rin kung ang lugar ng iyong pagbabakuna ay nasa California, at iniulat nito ang mga ibinigay nitong dosis sa estado.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano kung pinili kong hindi ibahagi ang aking data sa Mga System ng Impormasyon Tungkol sa Pagbabakuna (IIS)?
Answer: Iniulat pa rin ang data sa estado, kaya kwalipikado ka pa rin sa incentive at iba pang cash na papremyo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Paano inabisuhan ang mga nanalo?
Answer:
Pinoprotektahan ng estado ang iyong privacy, at may mga ginagawa itong hakbang para maprotektahan ang mga Californian mula sa mga scam. Ang mga nanalo ay inabisuhan ng mga opisyal ng Departamento ng Pampublikong Kalusugan ng California (California Department of Public Health, CDPH) sa pamamagitan ng opisyal na caller ID na "Estado ng CA CDPH," text, email address ng CDPH, o nang personal ng mga staff ng distrito ng CDPH. CDPH lang ang nakakaalam sa pagkakakilanlan ng taong nauugnay sa nabunot na random na numero. Para sa higit pang impormasyon, tingnan ang [Mga Tuntunin at Kundisyon](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vax-Win-Terms.aspx).

Ang mga nanalo ay hindi pinagbayad ng anumang singil na nauugnay sa pagkumpirma ng pagiging kwalipikado para sa cash na papremyo. Dapat iulat sa [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov) ang anumang mapanlokong aktibidad o maling impormasyon. Puwede ring gamitin ng mga indibidwal ang nasabing email address sa pag-uulat ng anumang alalahanin tungkol sa kung totoo ba ang anumang pakikipag-ugnayan sa kanila kaugnay ng mga cash na pampremyo.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Isinapubliko ba ninyo ang mga pangalan ng mga nanalo?
Answer: Walang inanunsyong pangalan sa panahon ng pag-draw. Puwedeng tanggihan ng mga mananalo ang premyo, o tanggihan nila ang publicity na nauugnay sa premyo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Kailangan bang mamamayan ng U.S. ang isang tao para manalo?
Answer:
Hindi. Ang pagiging kwalipikado ay hindi ibinatay sa status sa immigration. Ito lang ang mga pamantayang kailangang matugunan ng mga kwalipikadong manalo:

*   Nakatira sa California,
*   May edad na 12 taon pataas para sa mga incentive card at cash draw, 18 taon pataas para sa mga vacation draw,
*   At nakatanggap na ng hindi bababa sa isang dosis ng kanyang bakuna laban sa COVID-19.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Sino ang hindi naging kwalipikado?
Answer:
Hindi ka kwalipikado kung ikaw ay:

*   Isang empleyado ng ilang partikular na ahensya ng pamahalaan, o kung may kamag-anak kang ganito, 
*   Nakakulong,
*   Tumira sa labas ng California, o
*   Nagpabakuna sa labas ng California. 

Ibinibigay ang mga papremoyo pagkatapos makumpleto ng nanalo ang kanyang serye ng pagpapabakuna.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nakatanggap ako ng tawag tungkol sa Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo), na mukhang panloloko. Ano ang dapat kong gawin?
Answer:
Ang mga nanalo ay inabisuhan ng Departamento ng Pampublikong Kalusugan ng California at hindi pinagbayad ng anumang singil na nauugnay sa pagkumpirma ng pagiging kwalipikado para sa cash na papremyo.

Puwedeng iulat sa [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov) ang anumang mapanlokong aktibidad o maling impormasyon. Dapat ding gamitin ng mga indibidwal ang email address na ito sa pag-uulat ng anumang alalahanin tungkol sa kung totoo ba ang anumang pakikipag-ugnayan sa kanila kaugnay ng mga cash na pampremyo.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nagbahagi ba ng personal na impormasyong pangkalusugan sa mga programang ito ng incentive para sa bakuna?
Answer:
Hindi, hindi nagbahagi ang mga programang ito ng personal na impormasyong pangkalusugan ng mga Californian. Tumulong ang Lottery sa mga programa, pero hindi ito nakatanggap ng impormasyong nagbibigay ng personal na pagkakakilanlan. Anonymous ang lahat ng entry sa kanila.

Hindi inihayag ang mga pangalan ng mga nanalo nang hindi sila nagbibigay ng pahintulot. Gayunpaman, inianunsyo ang county ng nanalo. Tiniyak ng estado na patas, matapat, at legal ang mga raffle, at na mapoprotektahan ang personal na impormasyon ng mga tao.

More info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Sino ang nagbayad para sa programang ito?
Answer: Binayaran ng Estado ng California ang programang ito.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Nag-e-expire ba ang Mga Dream Vacation?
Answer: Oo. Dapat magamit ang Mga Dream Vacation sa Anaheim/Orange County at Dream Vacation sa San Diego bago ang Mayo 31, 2022. Dapat magamit ang Mga Dream Vacation sa San Francisco, Greater Palm Springs, at Los Angeles bago ang Hunyo 15, 2022.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Napapatawan ba ng buwis ang Mga Dream Vacation?
Answer: Oo.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win (Magpabakuna para Manalo)](https://covid19.ca.gov/tl/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How many COVID-19 vaccine doses do I need, and how far apart should I get them?
Answer:
Ideally, you’d get:

*   Two doses for the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine, 21 days apart, then a booster shot 5 months later
*   Two doses for the Moderna vaccine, 28 days apart, then a booster shot 5 months later 
*   Just one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine, then a booster shot 2 months later

If two shots are needed at first, get your second shot as close to the recommended interval as possible. If you can’t get it at the recommended interval, you can get your second dose up to 6 weeks (42 days) after the first dose. We have limited data on how well these vaccines work beyond this window. But if you get the second dose after 42 days, there is no need to start over.

Children aged 5-11 who get the lower-dose Pfizer vaccine should also get two shots 21 days apart.

Booster or additional doses of these vaccines are available for those 18 and older. Those aged 12-17 can get the Pfizer booster. The Moderna or Pfizer booster is recommended for those who got the Johnson & Johnson vaccine. Read [Booster shots and additional doses](#Booster-shots-and-additional-doses) to see if you are eligible.

Only a single booster dose is recommended now. You should not repeat a vaccine series.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can I mix and match COVID-19 vaccines from different manufacturers?
Answer:
Yes, after you complete your first vaccination series. In the United States, that means:

*   Two shots of the Pfizer vaccine 21 days apart, or 
*   Two shots of the Moderna vaccine 28 days apart, or 
*   One shot of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine

Then you may choose another vaccine to receive as a booster dose. Some people may prefer the vaccine they got before, and others may prefer to get a different booster. CDC recommendations now allow for this type of mix-and-match dosing for booster doses.

A Pfizer or Moderna booster is strongly advised for those who got the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: What if I was vaccinated outside the United States? Can I get a vaccination or a booster here?
Answer:
Yes. Here’s what the CDC recommends:

*   If you were vaccinated outside the U.S. with a vaccine approved or authorized by the FDA, you can get a second dose, booster dose, or additional dose. You must follow [U.S. eligibility and timing schedules](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines.html).
*   If you got one or both doses of a World Health Organization (WHO) Emergency Use Listed (EUL) vaccine, you can get a second dose, booster dose, or additional dose of the Pfizer vaccine. You must follow [U.S. eligibility and timing schedules](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines.html).
*   If you got a COVID-19 vaccine that’s not WHO-EUL, you should start over. Get an FDA-authorized/approved vaccine and follow its [timing schedule](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines.html).

Schedule your vaccination at [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How much will the COVID-19 vaccine cost?
Answer:
Nothing. COVID-19 vaccines and their administration are free to the public.

Read more at the Department of Managed Health Care’s [Know Your Health Care Rights (PDF)](https://www.dmhc.ca.gov/Portals/0/Docs/DO/VaccineFactSheetAccessible.pdf).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Do I need to be a California resident to get a COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer: No. Vaccine eligibility is based on age. Residency or immigration status does not matter.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do I cancel or reschedule my vaccine appointment through My Turn?
Answer:
If you need to cancel or reschedule your appointment, you can do so on the [Manage your appointments](https://myturn.ca.gov/manage) page.

You will be asked to confirm your appointment with:

*   Your appointment confirmation number, and 
*   Either your cell phone number or your email address.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: I’ve already had COVID-19. Should I get a COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
Yes. The CDC recommends that people who have already had COVID-19 get a COVID-19 vaccine. 

We do not know how long your protection lasts from getting infected again after you recover. 

One [study](https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/70/wr/mm7032e1.htm?s_cid=mm7032e1_e&ACSTrackingID=USCDC_921-DM63289&ACSTrackingLabel=MMWR%20Early%20Release%20-%20Vol.%2070%2C%20August%206%2C%202021&deliveryName=USCDC_921-DM63289) showed that unvaccinated people who already had COVID-19 are more than twice as likely as vaccinated people to get it again.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can I get vaccinated against COVID-19 while I am currently sick with COVID-19?
Answer: No. Wait until you have recovered and have met the [criteria for ending isolation](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/disposition-in-home-patients.html). This guidance also applies to people who get COVID-19 between their first and second dose.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will COVID-19 vaccine sites be accessible?
Answer: Yes. All vaccine clinics in California are required to meet ADA requirements.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do I get a COVID-19 vaccine at home if I am unable to travel to a vaccine site?
Answer:
Check with your healthcare provider, local health department, or local pharmacy. 

If you cannot leave your home, you can state this when booking on [myturn.ca.gov](https://myturn.ca.gov) or when calling [1-833-422-4255](tel:1-833-422-4255). If eligible, your local health jurisdiction will arrange for your in-home vaccination.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do I get transportation to a vaccine site?
Answer:
If you do not have a way to get to a vaccination site, you can receive free transportation through:

*   [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov), or 
*   By calling the state’s COVID-19 hotline at [1-833-422-4255](tel:1-833-422-4255).

Transportation options include:

*   Car transportation for ambulatory patients
*   Non-emergency medical transportation for non-ambulatory patients, including 
    *   Wheelchair vans
    *   Gurney transportation, and other options. 

You can also check with your local doctor, health department, or pharmacy.

If you have Medi-Cal managed care, you can get a ride through your health plan or doctor. Contact your plan’s member service department to ask for transportation.

If you get Medi-Cal through Fee-for-Service (FFS), you can get a list of transportation in your county. Contact them directly to arrange transportation to your appointments. 

If you have no provider, the Department of Health Care Services (DHCS) can assist. Email them at [DHCSNMT@dhcs.ca.gov](mailto:DHCSNMT@dhcs.ca.gov). Do NOT include personal information in your first email. DHCS staff will reply with a secure email asking for more information. 

If you need non-emergency medical transportation, inform your doctor. They can prescribe this service and put you in touch with transportation.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will I need a booster vaccination?
Answer:
Yes. It’s recommended that you get a booster shot as soon as you’re eligible:

*   If you got a **Moderna** or **Pfizer** vaccine, get a booster shot after 5 months
*   If you got a **Johnson & Johnson** vaccine, get a booster shot after 2 months

Your booster shot can be a different vaccine brand than you received before. A Pfizer or Moderna booster is strongly advised for those who got the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.

Moderna and Johnson & Johnson booster shots are only for those 18 and older. Pfizer booster shots can be given to those aged 12 and older.

Californians can schedule their booster shot or find a walk-in clinic at [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/)**.** Read [more about booster shots](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Pfizer-COVID-19-Vaccine-Boosters.aspx) and [booster questions and answers](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Booster-QA.aspx) from CDPH.

The CDC recommends additional doses of Pfizer or Moderna for those with compromised immunity. This includes those who: 

*   Get active cancer treatment for tumors or cancers of the blood
*   Got an organ transplant and are taking medicine to suppress the immune system
*   Got a stem cell transplant within the last 2 years or are taking medicine to suppress the immune system
*   Have moderate or severe primary immunodeficiency (such as DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome)
*   Have advanced or untreated HIV infection
*   Get active treatment with high-dose corticosteroids or other drugs that suppress immune response

Children aged 5-11 with these conditions can get an additional dose of Pfizer.

Talk to your doctor to see if getting an additional dose is right for you. If you meet these criteria, you can book your third dose at [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/).

See [questions and answers about additional doses](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/ThirdVaccineDoseQandA.aspx).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: What is acceptable as proof of full vaccination?
Answer:
The following are acceptable: 

*   Original DHHS CDC COVID-19 vaccination record card, which includes:
    *   Name of person vaccinated
    *   Date of birth 
    *   Type of vaccine provided
    *   Lot number
    *   Date last dose administered
    *   Site where administered

*   A photo or paper copy of your DHHS CDC COVID-19 vaccination record card
*   A photo of your vaccination record card stored on a phone or other electronic device
*   Paper or digital documentation of vaccination from a healthcare provider or other issuer.
*   A [Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (DCVR). 

Read CDPH’s [Vaccine Record Guidelines & Standards](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) for complete details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: What does it mean to be “fully vaccinated”?
Answer:
People are considered fully vaccinated for COVID-19:

*   Two weeks after they receive the second dose in a 2-dose series (Pfizer or Moderna), or
*   Two weeks after they receive a single-dose vaccine (Johnson & Johnson).

Booster doses are not required to be considered fully vaccinated. But we recommend you get a booster as soon as you’re eligible to get the most protection from COVID-19.

See CDPH’s [COVID-19 Public Health Recommendations for Fully Vaccinated People](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/COVID-19-Public-Health-Recommendations-for-Fully-Vaccinated-People.aspx) for details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will the COVID-19 vaccine make me test positive for COVID-19?
Answer:
No. A vaccine will not cause you to test positive on [viral tests](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/diagnostic-testing.html).

If your body develops an immune response, you may test positive on [antibody tests](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/testing/serology-overview.html). This shows that you may have protection against the virus.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How is my privacy protected if I take the COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
California law strictly limits how personal information can be shared. The state prevents individuals being identified in shared data.

Read more at CDPH’s [California Data Use Agreement and Frequently Asked Questions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/California-Data-Use-Agreement.aspx).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Should I keep my COVID-19 vaccination record card?
Answer:
Yes. Keep your vaccination record card in a safe place to prevent loss or damage

The [Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) (DCVR) portal gives you a digital copy of this record. If you’ve lost your paper card, print out your digital record. You can use it at any place where you would show your paper card.

Read CDPH’s [Vaccine Record Guidelines & Standards](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccine-Record-Guidelines-Standards.aspx) for complete details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: If I get a booster shot or additional dose, will it show on my digital vaccine record?
Answer:
They will not automatically show on your digital vaccine record. You will need to go to the [Digital COVID-19 Vaccine Record](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/) portal to get a new QR code.

Wait 14 days for your new dose to show up in the California Immunization Registry before you try to get a new QR code.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Do providers need parental consent before administering a COVID-19 vaccine to a minor?
Answer:
Yes. Before vaccinating a minor, vaccine providers must get consent from a:

*   Parent, 
*   Legal guardian, or 
*   Other adults having legal custody. 

There are some exceptions:

*   [Emancipated minors](https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/codes_displaySection.xhtml?lawCode=FAM&sectionNum=7050.) do not need the consent of a parent or guardian to receive a COVID-19 vaccine.
*   Providers may accept written consent. It must be from the parent or legal guardian of an unaccompanied minor. This consent must verify the parent/guardian has received the [Pfizer EUA Fact Sheet](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download).
*   Phone or video consent is acceptable. The parent/guardian must confirm that they received the [Pfizer EUA Fact Sheet](https://www.fda.gov/media/144414/download). Reading the fact sheet to the parent/guardian is an option.

Families should check with their vaccine provider on acceptable forms of consent. See CDPH’s [Pfizer Vaccine Minor Consent Guidance](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Pfizer-Vaccine-Minor-Consent-Guidance.aspx) for more details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Why should I vaccinate my child?
Answer:
Cases in children are increasing. We must get young people vaccinated to prevent more hospitalizations and deaths.

Vaccinations may stop the spread of coronavirus variants. They can also shrink the pool of people vulnerable to COVID-19. By getting children 5 and up vaccinated, families can be safer as we get back to doing the things we love.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: My child has had reactions to other vaccines. Should they still get the vaccine?
Answer:
Yes, unless they have had anaphylactic-type reactions to components of the Pfizer vaccine. Allergic reactions to the COVID-19 vaccine are rare. Talk to your child’s doctor before vaccination if they’ve had: 

*   Severe allergies
*   Flu vaccination reactions

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can children who have pre-existing conditions like asthma get vaccinated?
Answer: Youth aged 5 and up can still receive the COVID-19 vaccine even if they have health conditions. Talk to your doctor or clinic about your child’s specific conditions.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will my child have to get vaccinated to attend in-person schooling?
Answer: Yes. Students will soon be required to be vaccinated for in-person learning. This will start the term following FDA full approval of the vaccine for their grade span (7-12 and K-6). The COVID-19 vaccine will be added to the list of required vaccinations for school. This includes vaccines for measles, mumps, rubella and more.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Why did it take longer for the COVID-19 vaccine to be approved for youth?
Answer:
Vaccine trials commonly begin with older, more vulnerable populations. They then extend to younger ages. This phased eligibility approach balances the need for both safety and speed.

Clinical trials in more than 4,500 children ages 5-11 prove the COVID-19 vaccine is safe and effective. It results in a strong antibody response in children who received the vaccines.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: I’m an employer and want to help my employees get vaccinated. How do I do that?
Answer:
The [Employer Vaccination Toolkit](https://saferatwork.covid19.ca.gov/employer-vaccination-toolkit/) provides all the information you need to:

*   Partner with local providers for offsite vaccination events
*   Request a worksite mobile clinic
*   Help employees find and book vaccination appointments
*   Share and promote resources that support employees in getting vaccinated

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can an employer require COVID-19 vaccination for all employees entering a workplace?
Answer:
Yes, if certain requirements are met. Under the ADA, an employer may insist all employees to meet a standard that is:

*   Job-related, and 
*   Meets with a business need

This could include a safety-related standard requiring COVID-19 vaccination.

If an employee cannot be vaccinated because of a disability, the employer may not require them to. The exception to that is if the employee’s non-compliance poses a threat to their health or safety or that of others in the workplace.

Read [What You Should Know About COVID-19 and the ADA, the Rehabilitation Act, and Other EEO Laws](https://www.eeoc.gov/wysk/what-you-should-know-about-covid-19-and-ada-rehabilitation-act-and-other-eeo-laws).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are people with certain jobs required to be vaccinated?
Answer:
Yes. In California these include:

*   Healthcare workers
*   Those who work in congregate settings (like homeless shelters and correctional facilities)
*   State employees
*   Care workers
*   K-12 teachers and school staff

**Healthcare workers** and **workers in congregate settings** must be fully vaccinated and get a booster. Exceptions can only be made for those with:

*   Conflicting religious beliefs, or
*   Qualified medical reasons. 

If they are not fully vaccinated, they are required to:

*   Get tested for COVID-19 regularly
*   Wear masks or other personal protective equipment (PPE) at work. 

Read more in:

*   [Health Care Worker Vaccine Requirement Q&A](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/FAQ-Health-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement.aspx)
*   [Adult Care Facilities and Direct Care Worker Requirement Q&A](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Adult-Care-Facilities-and-Direct-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement-FAQ.aspx)
*   [Protection in High-Risk Settings Q&A](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Unvaccinated-Workers-in-High-Risk-Settings-State-Public-Health-Order-FAQ.aspx)
*   [Vaccination requirement for health care workers in correctional facilities and detention centers](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Correctional-Facilities-and-Detention-Centers-Health-Care-Worker-Vaccination-Order.aspx)

****California state employees**** must be fully vaccinated or be regularly tested for COVID-19. See details at [CalHR’s Vaccine Verification and Testing Requirements (PDF)](https://www.calhr.ca.gov/Documents/Vaccine-Verification-and-Testing-Requirements.pdf).

****K-12 teachers**** and ****school employees**** must [be vaccinated or be tested weekly](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Vaccine-Verification-for-Workers-in-Schools.aspx) for COVID-19.

****Workers in adult and senior care facilities**** and ****in-home care workers**** must be vaccinated. For details and exceptions, see the [September 28 public health order](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Adult-Care-Facilities-and-Direct-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement.aspx).

CDPH expanded this order to include **workers in senior living** and **hospice workers**. See [expansion of vaccine requirement FAQ](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Adult-Care-Facilities-and-Direct-Care-Worker-Vaccine-Requirement-FAQ.aspx) for details.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: If I get a COVID-19 vaccine, will I still need a flu shot?
Answer: Yes. COVID-19 vaccine does not provide protection against flu.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are there certain populations who should not get a COVID-19 vaccine? What about people with allergies?
Answer:
The [CDC recommends](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html) that:

*   If you had a severe or immediate reaction to an mRNA vaccine or its ingredients:
    *   Do not get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine. 
    *   Ask your doctor if you can get the Janssen vaccine.
*   If you had a severe or immediate reaction to the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or its ingredients:
    *   Do not get it again. 
    *   Ask your doctor if you can get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine.
*   If you had an immediate allergic reaction after getting the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine:
    *   Do not get the second dose.  
*   If you are allergic to PEG:
    *   Do not get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine.
    *   Ask your doctor if you can get the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.
*   If you are allergic to polysorbate:
    *   Do not get the Johnson & Johnson vaccine.
    *   Ask your doctor if you can get the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine.

People with medical conditions can get vaccinated, as long as they are not [allergic to vaccine ingredients](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/allergic-reaction.html). Learn more about [vaccination considerations for people with underlying medical conditions](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/underlying-conditions.html).

To learn about the ingredients in authorized COVID-19 vaccines, see

*   [Information about the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Pfizer-BioNTech.html)
*   [Information about the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/Moderna.html)
*   [Information About Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/different-vaccines/janssen.html)

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: If I’m pregnant or breastfeeding, should I get the COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
Yes. The CDC strongly recommends that if you’re pregnant or or could be pregnant, you get vaccinated. If you get COVID-19 while you are pregnant, you are more likely to get severely ill.  

The vaccines are safe for you and your baby. They do not contain the live virus, so they cannot cause COVID-19. Vaccinated pregnant people also pass antibodies to their fetus in the womb. Their babies are then born with some protection.

COVID-19 vaccines are also safe for those who breastfeed and their babies. Breastfeeding people who got Moderna or Pfizer vaccines have antibodies in their breast milk. This could help protect their babies.

Talk to your doctor if you have questions about getting a COVID-19 vaccine.

For more information, read:

*   CDPH’s [Guidance for Vaccination During Pregnancy](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vaccination-During-Pregnancy-Guidance.aspx)
*   CDC’s [COVID-19 Vaccines While Pregnant or Breastfeeding](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/recommendations/pregnancy.html)
*   CDPH’s [COVID-19 Vaccine and Pregnancy (PDF)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/CDPH%20Document%20Library/COVID-19/COVID-19-Vaccine-and-Pregnancy.pdf)

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How long should I wait to get the vaccine after I’ve had COVID-19?
Answer:
The [CDC recommends:](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fvaccines%2Fcovid-19%2Finfo-by-product%2Fpfizer%2Fclinical-considerations.html)

*   If you tested positive, had only mild symptoms, and were not treated, you should:
    *   Wait at least 10 days after the start of COVID-19 symptoms, and 
    *   Meet [criteria to stop isolation](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/disposition-in-home-patients.html) before getting the COVID-19 vaccine.
*   Wait 90 days to get the vaccine if:
    *   You recovered from a COVID-19 infection, and 
    *   Were treated with monoclonal antibodies or convalescent plasma.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Can I get a COVID-19 vaccine at the same time as another vaccine?
Answer: Yes, you can get a COVID-19 vaccine and other vaccines (like for the flu) at the same visit. You no longer need to wait 14 days between different vaccinations. Learn more about [getting more than one kind of vaccine](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/info-by-product/clinical-considerations.html#Coadministration).\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Will I have a choice between the various COVID-19 vaccines?
Answer:
Yes. Both [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) and [Vaccines.gov](https://vaccines.gov/search/) allow you to search for vaccines by manufacturer.

Read CDPH’s [Choosing the COVID-19 Vaccine That is Right for You (PDF)](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/CDPH%20Document%20Library/COVID-19/Which-Vaccine-is-Right-for-Me-Fact-Sheet.pdf).

If you’re getting a booster shot, you can choose to get a different vaccine brand than you originally got.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are the COVID-19 vaccines FDA-approved?
Answer:
Two are. Pfizer’s vaccine, now named Comirnaty, has full FDA approval for use in anyone aged 16 and up. The Moderna vaccine is approved for those aged 18 and up.

The FDA can allow using vaccines before full approval. This is called an Emergency Use Authorization (EUA). It lets us respond quickly to emergency situations like a pandemic. EUAs still involve rigorous testing for safety and effectiveness.

The Johnson & Johnson vaccine has an EUA for use in anyone aged 18 and up. The Pfizer vaccine has an EUA for use in children aged 12 to 15. The lower-dose Pfizer vaccine has an EUA for use in children aged 5 to 11.

If you’ve been waiting for full FDA approval of a vaccine before getting vaccinated, the wait is over. Visit [My Turn](https://myturn.ca.gov/) and book your Pfizer or Moderna vaccination today.

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are the COVID-19 vaccines mandatory?
Answer: No. Neither the state or federal government requires you to get vaccinated. We hope Californians will opt for vaccination once they see how safe and effective it is.\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Do I need to be vaccinated to visit a healthcare facility?
Answer:
Yes. You must show proof of full vaccination and booster (if it’s been 6 months or more since your vaccination) if you visit a:

*   Hospital
*   Skilled nursing facility
*   Intermediate care facility 
*   Adult and senior care facility

If you are not fully vaccinated and boosted, you must show proof of a negative COVID-19 test from within:

*   One day before the visit (for antigen test)
*   Two days before the visit (for PCR test)

Exceptions to this rule are:

*   Visits to a patient where death is imminent
*   Emergency situations

All visitors must wear masks and PPE and keep social distance during their visit. Read CDPH’s [healthcare visitor requirements](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Requirements-for-Visitors-in-Acute-Health-Care-and-Long-Term-Care-Settings.aspx) and [FAQ](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Order-of-the-State-Public-Health-Officer-Requirements-for-Visitors-in-Acute-Health-Care-and-Long-Term-Care-Settings-FAQ.aspx).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How can I convince my family and friends to take a COVID-19 vaccine?
Answer:
Talking with family and friends about the benefits of getting a COVID-19 vaccine can be hard. Try to listen without judgment and identify the root of their concerns. Things to remember to help open the discussion include:

*   Listen to questions with empathy
*   Ask open-ended questions to explore concerns
*   Ask permission to share information
*   Help them find their own reason to get vaccinated
*   Help make their vaccination happen

Read the CDC’s [How to talk about COVID-19 vaccines with friends and family](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/talk-about-vaccines.html?ACSTrackingID=USCDC_2067-DM52837&ACSTrackingLabel=How%20to%20Talk%20to%20Family%20and%20Friends%20about%20COVID-19%20Vaccines%20%7C%20COVID-19&deliveryName=USCDC_2067-DM52837).

More info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Are vaccines safe for children aged 5 and older?
Answer: Pfizer’s COVID-19 vaccine is [authorized for kids aged 12 and up](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-emergency-use).  A lower dose of the Pfizer vaccine is now [authorized for kids aged 5 to 11](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/fda-authorizes-pfizer-biontech-covid-19-vaccine-emergency-use-children-5-through-11-years-age).\n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: How do COVID-19 vaccines work?
Answer: COVID-19 vaccines teach our immune systems how to fight the virus that causes COVID-19. It is still possible to get COVID-19 after vaccination. But your symptoms will likely be much less severe, helping you avoid hospitalization and death. \n\nMore info: [Vaccines](https://covid19.ca.gov/vaccines/)

Question: Chart information
Answer:
*   This chart is made using California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Genomic Surveillance Data.
*   These percentages are based on a 7-day average with a 14-day lag.
*   These percentages are based on a sampling of positive COVID-19 tests. They do not represent the total number of infections in California.
*   This does not represent all sequences completed to date.
*   This chart does not show all variants identified. It shows only those that are or were considered variants of concern.
*   The California Department of Public Health works with many partners to achieve a goal of sequencing at least 10% of all positive tests. This creates a confident projection of variant distribution in California.
*   We update this data on Thursdays.
*   Learn more about [how California genetically sequences positive COVID-19 tests](https://testing.covid19.ca.gov/covidnet/).

More info: [Variants](https://covid19.ca.gov/variants/)

Question: How long will the incentive cards last? When will the program run out?
Answer: Cards were only available for the first 2 million eligible individuals who started their vaccination process between May 27 and July 18, 2021. The program ended January 7, 2022.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: If I got my first dose before the incentive card program started, then get my second dose after it started, am I eligible?
Answer: No, you were not eligible to receive an incentive card. But you were eligible for the other cash and vacation prizes. The purpose of the card program was to motivate unvaccinated Californians to get vaccinated.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Can I get the $50 incentive card if I completed my vaccination before the program started?
Answer: No. The incentive card program was intended to motivate the remaining Californians to get vaccinated. However, fully vaccinated Californians were eligible for other cash and vacation prizes.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How do I get my redemption code?
Answer: If you started your vaccination between May 27 and July 18, 2021, you got a redemption code by text or email within 7-10 days after your last vaccination. For those receiving a two-dose series, your $50 card was set aside until your completed second dose.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How long after redeeming the incentive card did it take to receive it?
Answer: It took up to five business days to receive the incentive card.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How did people prove they had both doses? What if someone tries to cheat with a fake vaccine card?
Answer: COVID-19 vaccines are tracked in California immunization records. Incentive cards and other cash prizes will be awarded based on those records.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Was there a choice of incentive cards?
Answer:
Yes, there were three choices:

1.  Virtual Mastercard®: Not an ATM card so it cannot be cashed out. It can be redeemed online where Debit Mastercard® is accepted. This is a virtual incentive card and can be added to a phone mobile wallet.
2.  Kroger: Good at Ralphs, Food 4 Less and Foods Co. We recommend printing the card, as not all grocery stores can scan it on a phone. _(Note: Some Food 4 Less stores in Northern California and the Central Coast do not accept this card as payment. _Check this_ [_list of participating Kroger locations_ (PDF)](https://files.covid19.ca.gov/pdf/Ralphs-Food4Less-FoodsCo-CA-list.pdf)_._)_
3.  Albertsons: Good at Safeway, Albertsons, Vons, Pavilions, and Andronico's Community Markets. We recommend printing the card, as not all grocery stores can scan it on a phone.

If you were younger than 18, you needed to have a parent or guardian complete the card selection process for you, unless you are an emancipated minor.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Does my redemption code ever expire?
Answer: Yes. You must have used the redemption code by January 7, 2022. Once claimed, the Virtual Mastercard® expires after 12 months. The grocery cards never expire.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What did I need to do to enter the drawings?
Answer: You just had to get vaccinated in California for COVID-19 before winners were drawn. No entry form was needed; you were automatically entered in the drawing based on California immunization records once your vaccinator provided the state vaccination registry with your information. Vaccinations counted whether you got the Pfizer, Moderna, or Johnson & Johnson vaccine. You must have been living in California to win. Winner got the prize after they completed their vaccination series.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What if I got vaccinated outside of California’s My Turn system?
Answer: You did not need to vaccinate through My Turn to be eligible. You were still eligible if your vaccination site was in California and reported doses given to the state.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: What if I opted to not share my data with the Immunization Information Systems (IIS)?
Answer: The data was still reported to the state, so you would still be eligible for the incentive and other cash prizes.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: How were winners notified?
Answer:
The state protects your privacy, and has taken steps to protect Californians against scams. The winners were notified by officials from the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) through official "State of CA CDPH" caller ID, text, CDPH email address, or in person by CDPH district staff. Only CDPH knows the identity of the person associated with the random number that has been drawn. For more information, see the [Terms and Conditions](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Vax-Win-Terms.aspx).

Winners were not asked to pay any fees associated with verifying eligibility for the cash prize. Any fraudulent activities or misinformation should be reported to [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov). Individuals can use this email address to report any concerns about the authenticity of any contact they have received related to cash prizes.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Did you make public the names of winners?
Answer: At the time of the drawing, no names were announced. Winners could decline the prize, or decline publicity associated with the prize.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Did a person need to be a U.S. citizen to win?
Answer:
No. Eligibility was not determined by immigration status. Those eligible to win must only have met the following criteria:

*   Lived in California,
*   Were aged 12 and older for incentive cards and cash drawings, 18 and older for vacations drawings,
*   And received at least a first dose of their COVID-19 vaccine.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Who was not eligible?
Answer:
You were not eligible if you were:

*   An employee of certain government agencies or their immediate family member, 
*   Incarcerated,
*   Lived outside of California, or
*   Got vaccinated outside of California. 

Prizes were awarded after the winner completed their vaccination series.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: I got a call about Vax for the Win that seemed fraudulent. What should I do?
Answer:
Winners were notified by the California Department of Public Health and were not be asked to pay any fees associated with verifying eligibility for the cash prize.

Any fraudulent activities or misinformation can be reported to [rumors@cdph.ca.gov](mailto:rumors@cdph.ca.gov). Individuals should also use this email address to report any concerns about the authenticity of any contact they have received related to cash prizes.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Was personal health information shared through these vaccine incentive programs?
Answer:
No, Californians' personal health information was not shared by these programs. The Lottery assisted the programs, but did not receive personally-identifiable information. All entries were anonymous to them.

The names of winners weren't disclosed without their consent. However, the county of the winner was announced. The state ensured the drawings were fair, honest, legal, and protective of personal information.

More info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Who paid for this program?
Answer: This program was paid for by the State of California.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Do the Dream Vacations expire?
Answer: Yes. The Anaheim/Orange County Dream Vacation and the San Diego Dream Vacations must be used by May 31, 2022. The San Francisco, Greater Palm Springs and Los Angeles Dream Vacations must be used by June 15, 2022.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Are the Dream Vacations taxable?
Answer: Yes.\n\nMore info: [Vax for the Win](https://covid19.ca.gov/vax-for-the-win/)

Question: Tôi có thể tìm danh sách các lĩnh vực hạ tầng quan trọng thiết yếu ở đâu?
Answer: Truy cập [Lực lượng lao động thiết yếu](/vi/essential-workforce/) để tìm hiểu những lĩnh vực và đối tượng người lao động nào được đưa vào danh sách.\n\nMore info: [Lực lượng lao động thiết yếu](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/essential-workforce/)<!-- non-essential, non-critical -->

Question: Tôi nên làm vì nếu tôi có thể đã bị phơi nhiễm COVID-19?
Answer:
Hãy cân nhắc đi xét nghiệm, ngay cả khi quý vị đã tiêm vắc-xin. Hiểu rõ tình trạng của bản thân để có thể tránh lây nhiễm cho người khác. Đeo khẩu trang khi ở gần những người khác cho đến khi quý vị chắc chắn là mình không bị nhiễm bệnh.

Nếu quý vị có [triệu chứng](https://www.cdph.ca.gov/Programs/CID/DCDC/Pages/COVID-19/Symptoms-Risks.aspx), hãy ở nhà và [tự cách ly](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/if-you-are-sick/isolation.html) với những người khác trong hộ gia đình.

More info: [Testing](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/get-tested/)

Question: Chương trình bảo hiểm y tế của tôi có bao trả cho dịch vụ xét nghiệm COVID-19 tại địa điểm xét nghiệm không?
Answer:
Có. [Hướng dẫn của liên bang (PDF)](https://www.dmhc.ca.gov/Portals/0/Docs/DO/APL21-011-NewFederalGuidanceRegardingCOVID-19Testing.pdf) yêu cầu các chương trình bảo hiểm y tế xét nghiệm miễn phí cho mọi người. Quý vị không nhất thiết phải có các triệu chứng hoặc đã phơi nhiễm COVID-19. Quý vị không nhất thiết phải là “người lao động trong các ngành nghề thiết yếu” mới được xét nghiệm.

Để được xét nghiệm, quý vị có thể tới bất kỳ nhà cung cấp dịch vụ xét nghiệm COVID-19 nào được tiểu bang ủy quyền hoặc cấp phép. Quý vị không cần phải đến nhà cung cấp trong mạng lưới nhà cung cấp thuộc chương trình bảo hiểm y tế hay công ty bảo hiểm y tế của mình. Quý vị không cần xin phép chương trình bảo hiểm y tế hay công ty bảo hiểm y tế của mình trước khi đến xét nghiệm COVID-19. Và quý vị không cần thanh toán khoản đồng trả cho xét nghiệm COVID-19.

More info: [Testing](https://covid19.ca.gov/vi/get-tested/)

Question: Tôi nên làm gì nếu tôi không có bảo hiểm y tế và tôi cần nhận dịch vụ chăm sóc hoặc xét nghiệm COVID-19?
Answer: Đối với những người không có bảo hiểm, [chính phủ chi trả](https://www.hrsa.gov/CovidUninsuredClaim) tất cả các chi phí chăm sóc và xét nghiệm COVID-19 cần thiết.
